This suggests that both radiation and surgery are viable options for stage I cancer larynx. However, it does not provide a clear treatment of choice.

The third document talks about current trends in the treatment of cancer of the larynx. The fourth document talks about the role of renal-sparing surgery for renal cell carcinoma. Although it is not directly related to laryngeal cancer, it highlights the importance of preserving organ function when possible.
